column7: TechnologyOne is committed to attracting and retaining talented individuals by providing them with an environment where they can be innovative and creative and realise their full potential.

column13: The TechnologyOne Way is the cornerstone of our corporate culture, influencing our behaviour and choices. It encompasses our fundamental beliefs and encourages responsible business practices, with a commitment and dedication to excellence in corporate governance, accountability, innovation, and transparency in all our endeavours. These beliefs and principles define our value proposition to our customers and protect the interests of our shareholders and other stakeholders.
column20: Corporate Culture, Core Beliefs, Business Practices

column13: Our ESG-related risks include a 15 percent reduction in asset-related labour costs, carbon emissions, and energy consumption. Opportunities are integrated into our Risk Management Framework and managed as part of our overall business strategy. Risk level assessments are routinely undertaken, where the Board maintains oversight of our material enterprise risks.
column20: Risk Management Framework, Sustainable Value, Enterprise Risks

column13: To protect and enhance our sustainable value, TechnologyOne has an established enterprise risk management framework that sets out a dynamic and structured approach for identifying, assessing, mitigating, and monitoring existing and emerging risks. Climate risks are included in the scope of our risk management framework, and during the year, we strengthened our tools to identify and assess climate-related risks and opportunities.
column20: Climate Risks, Risk Assessment, Risk Management

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column7: Our Independent Whistleblower Service (Stopline) is available 24/7 with translation services and is our primary means for whistleblowers to report concerns. These are called TechnologyOne's Whistleblower Officers, with oversight provided to the Board on significant matters raised, the number of notifications and their status.

column13: Each year, we issue Service Organisational Control (SOC) reports to assure our customers that our services are reliable, secure, private, and compliant. Our SOC reports are independently audited and contain design and effectiveness verifications. Our SaaS services aim to exceed SOC compliance standards by going beyond the minimum requirements.
column20: Service Organizational Control, Service Assurance, Compliance Reports

column13: Our primary focus is safeguarding existing revenue streams while fostering ongoing growth to ensure sustainable returns for our shareholders. Our approach revolves around creating long-term, sustainable value that serves the interests of investors and extends to employees, customers, and the communities in which we operate.
column20: Sustainable Value, Value Proposition, Stakeholder Interests

column13: In July, we recognised NAIDOC Week, encouraging engagement in the broader community for curiosity and reflection on Australia's history, culture, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. As a proud Australian company with strong community ties through the TechnologyOne Foundation and a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging Ã¢ÂÂ we're excited to formalise and embed the principles and purpose of reconciliation across our business.
column20: Indigenous Awareness, Community Engagement, Diversity Promotion

column13: Through our online Customer Community, customers can connect, communicate, and work together with us and with each other to get the most out of our solutions while also assisting us in constantly developing and delivering product ideas. Over 85 per cent of product enhancements are based on direct feedback from our customers.
column20: Customer Engagement, Product Development, Feedback Incorporation

column7: During the year, we reviewed our stakeholder engagement and materiality assessment to ensure that our ESG agenda remains closely aligned with our stakeholders' interests and the everyday needs of our business. Our process generally followed the methodology suggested by the GRI standards. It was based on material relevance to our business model, corporate strategy, enterprise risks, key performance indicators, and material importance for our business and operations as perceived and experienced by our key stakeholder groups.
Responsible Business, Our Customers and Community, Our People, Our Environment, Our Reporting

column13: Continue to strengthen our systems to evaluate, monitor and report on ESG performance in alignment with our sustainability goals. Maintain our industry-leading investment in R&D for continued innovation and implement our FY24 initiatives aimed at $500m+ in ARR by FY25 and continuing to double in size every five years.
column20: ESG Performance, Risk Integration, Business Strategy

column13: With the International Sustainability Standards Board's June 2023 release of the IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards, moving forward, we will progress maturity on quantifying the impacts of climate-related risks and opportunities and the metrics and targets for measuring, monitoring and managing climate-related risks and opportunities, amongst other critical areas, in transitioning to the new disclosure standards ahead of legislated timeframes.
column20: Sustainability Goals, Environmental Impact, Business Strategy Alignment

column13: In 2015, the United Nations adopted the 17 SDGs to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all by 2030. Our mission of building and delivering truly great products and services that transform business while delivering long-term value for shareholders aligns with many SDGs.
column20: Sustainability Disclosure Standards, Disclosure Compliance, Reporting Transition

We offer our customers a range of industry-leading preconfigured enterprise solutions.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: For every tonne of carbon attributable to TechnologyOne, a tonne of carbon credits is purchased by TechnologyOne and retired. Our carbon offset credits are sourced from projects related to India's solar and wind power initiatives.
column20: Carbon Offset Credits, Climate Change Mitigation, Renewable Energy Support

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: To better understand the strategic implications of climate-related risks and opportunities, we matured our assessment of potential future scenarios to maximise our business's positive and negative impacts. In 2021, we undertook a high-level climate scenario analysis against the impacts of a 2ÃÂ°C and 4ÃÂ°C climate increase above pre-industrial levels, and in 2022, we expanded our study to include a 2ÃÂ°C climate increase scenario characterised by late and disorderly action.

column8: Salvation Army Red Shield Appeal campaign
column13: During the Salvation Army Red Shield Appeal campaign focusing on homelessness and poverty, we launched the appeal during a Town Hall event. We attended the launch event across regions to learn more about the work and the impact. We activated the dollar matching initiative to match the team members' donations and collectively raised $25,000 for the appeal. The fund allows our partner to provide life-changing care to those struggling through food vouchers, accommodation and financial assistance.
column20: Salvation Army Appeal, Dollar Matching Initiative, Fundraising Impact

column6: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community

column13: We commissioned a study with IBRS and Insight Economics on the economic impact of SaaS to better understand the potential and cumulative economic benefits to Australia. Modelling showed that the potential direct benefit to Australian organisations in moving to SaaS solutions compared to current software capabilities is 252 billion dollars over the next ten years. This research also showed that an increase in cloud computing from 25 per cent to 40 per cent by 2025 Ã¢ÂÂ enabling the retirement of small, inefficient data centres Ã¢ÂÂ could reduce energy use by 80 per cent, aiding Australia to avoid 4Mt CO2-e emissions by 2030.
column20: Economic Impact Study, SaaS Solutions, Cloud Computing Benefits

column13: We're leveraging our unique domain experience of over 36 years and our unwavering commitment to our industries with SaaS Plus. SaaS Plus is our all-inclusive offering tailored to our industries, delivering industry-specific software solutions. Harnessing TechnologyOne's unique 'Power of One', SaaS Plus offers end-to-end software implementation quickly, securely, and efficiently.
column20: Domain Experience, SaaS Plus Offering, End-to-end Implementation

column13: This philosophy allows our customers to establish a strategic partnership with a single vendor and avoid the complexity, risk, and inefficiency of having multiple platforms and vendor relationships. The power of one enables us to deeply understand and optimise the customer experience at every stage of the journey.

column13: Our online User Connect series connects customers with industry insights, business transformation initiatives and new product innovations. column13: We continue to recognise that our customers are our true north for our decisions, the people we employ and the processes we create. The program supports and encourages our team members so that they can provide exceptional customer service every day.

column13: We continue to focus our research and development (R&D) efforts on new and emerging technologies, including cloud-based technologies, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and other innovations. column6: Proportion of spending on local suppliers

On this front, our responsible sourcing agenda includes prioritised engagements with suppliers who have established ESG practices.

column6: Proportion of spending on local suppliers
